snippet: A London judge on Friday denied bail to Domenico Rancadore, wanted by the Italian police since 1999 to serve a seven-year sentence for extortion and other mob crimes.
abstract: British Judge Quentin Purdy denies bail to Domenico Rancadore, Sicilian mafia boss wanted by the Italian police since 1999 to serve a seven-year sentence for extortion and other mob crimes; Racadore will remain in custody of London police while he awaits extradition proceedings.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Siena, Italy.

lead_paragraph: A London judge on Friday denied bail to Domenico Rancadore, wanted by the Italian police since 1999 to serve a seven-year sentence for extortion and other mob crimes.

headline.main: Suburban London Father Is Revealed as a Fugitive Italian Mobster
headline.print_headline: Suburban London Father Is Revealed as a Fugitive Italian
